24.m: And we know that for those who love God all things work together for good, for those who are called according to his purpose. - Romans 8:28 (ESV)

l.q: As saints in Christ, what can we hope for in the midst of the sufferings of this present time?
l.a: As saints in Christ, we have hope that we will be freed from our corruption and be revealed as God's sons. God's love for us is everlasting, and there is nothing that can separate us from His love. We are not anymore facing condemnation but are more than conquerors through Christ who loved us.

l.q: Who helps us in our weakness?
l.a: The Spirit helps us in our weakness by interceding for us in prayer.

l.q: In verse 28, what is the comfort of those who love God?
l.a: All things work together for good for those who love God and are called according to His purpose.

24.p: Heavenly Father, thank you for the encouraging and comforting words of truth. We may live in an imperfect world, but we are not without hope. There will come a time when all pain will be gone for those who are in Christ. Thank you for the Holy Spirit. You hold everything in your hands, and you know what is truly best for us, and we continue to put our trust in your loving arms. Thank you for everything.
